All Reviews

  1. The shampoo was a new experience compared to my previous shampoo. When I washed my head I didn't feel the suds like how my old shampoo gave. I have oily hair so lets see how it goes as the day goes on by. Overall, it feels like every other shampoo, except it feels like you are putting on conditioner.
  2. I have tried so many anti-dandruff shampoos for my itchy scalp and this finally is doing the job i looked for in a shampoo. I had to shampoo every day to not have itchy and greasy scalp but i can forgo a couple of days and still be left with soft and clean hair. I can finally use all the styling products, which were otherwise a huge no-no with my greasy hair. Make sure to leave the shampoo in for a couple of minutes for it to do its magic. This is a review after a month of use and it works great for me. i just wish it had a more pleasant smell to it but i always condition my hair later so it not a huge issue for me.
  3. The product was extremely drying. It will strip your hair and scalp of any moisture. It irritated my scalp to no other causing way more dryness and itch than ever before.
  4. This shampoo has a fresh clean scent and leaves my hair so squeaky clean and shiny. It doesnt strip it of moisture.
  5. This shampoo is horrible. My hair is literally worst after using it. I'm still trying to undo the damage. I purchased this product because I have somewhat damaged hair from using the hair straightener but my roots get oily quickly. After using this shampoo, I didn't see much help with the oil issue, my hair become oily after the 3rd day being unwashed which was typical however, I did notice that it was drying out my ends really badly and I wasn't even applying the shampoo on my ends at all. I was also using the Argan oil conditioner which I also wrote a review on and it didn't help much. The conditioner was a little better than this shampoo because it smelled nice and it didn't damage my hair but it also didn't help it. I have since stopped using these (very expensive and ineffective products) and have returned to my regular drug store shampoo and have been using a million masks and treatments to regain the moisture in the ends of my hair. Very disappointed.
  6. A friend of mine has maple holistics degrease shampoo and let me try it. While I only used it once, my hair that day felt lighter and less weighed down but still moisturized. The smell was clean and refreshing. I plan on getting this for myself and look forward to seeing the long term results.
  7. I am so glad that I bought this. I have no idea why, but after I had my first son eleven months ago, I had the worst case of itch scalp and flakes. It was disgusting and so embarrassing. I tried almost everything. I used Head and Shoulders, Selsun Blue, Paul Mitchell's Tea Tree Shampoos and Conditioners, even more expensive shampoos and conditioners recommended by my hair stylists and nothing worked. I finally did a little research and decided to try natural shampoos and conditioners. I saw a difference with the first use. My head stopped itching, I still had a little flakes here and there but it's a huge difference. I've been using this shampoo for almost a month now and the results are still amazing. I still have some dry flakes after shampooing sometimes but it's not that bad. I'm not a fan of the conditioner, same brand (Maples Holistic Silk 18) though. It does not moisturize my hair at all. I've ordered a different brand and hope that week be better. But I'm so glad I bought this shampoo. I recommended it to a coworker too, hope it helps her like it's helped me.
  8. i looove this shampoo for oily and itchy hair what a great product
  9. This stuff is truly amazing. It doesn't just strip your hair of moisture like some other salon grade degreasers. It actually PREVENTS your locks from becoming oily through out the day. This is the only shampoo I have found that keeps my hair in check all day long.

Some frame of reference for this review: I bought this shampoo because I was looking for a new product to try and I typically buy shampoos that use natural ingredients, but am no expert in this market. I usually wash my hair every 1-2 days. My hair tends to get a little oily on the second day after washing in the winter time and on the third day after washing in the summer time. I occasionally get dandruff and an itchy scalp, so I don’t think my scalp is the healthiest of scalps that one can have. My hair is not colored or permed. Shampooing phase: The shampoo smells like a mixture of mint and rosemary. After the wash, it left my hair smelling rather neutral. I followed the directions on the bottle and use a quarter-sized dollop of shampoo which lathered more than thoroughly into my hair (which is medium length) and scalp. I let it sit for 2-3 minutes and my scalp started feeling refreshed in a minty way. My hair felt clean after the shampooing. And I conditioned the ends of my hair, using a different-branded product. Day 1 after Shampooing phase: As expected, my hair usually is not greasy the day after shampooing. My hair and scalp doesn’t feel different from normal. Day 2 after Shampooing phase: My hair felt clean in the morning but by the end of the day it felt oily enough to feel necessary to wash. All in all, the shampoo doesn’t seem to be anything special to me after first use. I would have given it 4 stars but deducted one star for its high price relative to the amount of shampoo received. I will update this review after having gone through the whole bottle, with whether I have a sense that this shampoo has had some longer term benefits for my hair and scalp. Perhaps results will change. UPDATE (5/3/2015) - I've been using this shampoo everyday to every other day for the past couple months and have seen no results in how oily my hair gets after a day. If anything, I would say that my hair gets greasy more quickly than usual where I'vebeen relegated to washing my hair everyday since using this shampoo regularly.
  74. I just received the bottle and I have no issues with the packaging. In good condition with no broken bottle. I like the fact that writing this review provides me a free bottle, I think that's good customer service and considering the bottle is pretty small given the price, I believe three months will better determine whether or not I find it effective. I will return to complete the review after I use the shampoo for three months. As of yet, I have fine black hair that has never been colored and rarely blow-dried. My hair is medium length with few split ends but my scalp is often itchy if I don't wash after a day. I want to go sulfate free and see if I can shampoo less and still have a clean scalp. I 'm hoping this shampoo will do the trick.
  75. I've transitioned from one shampoo to another for a long time, until now. Previous shampoos have left my scalp feeling dry--if not immediately then after a few hours. Using this shampoo, not only do I feel that my hair is clean (squeaky clean!), but the clean feeling lasts just about a whole day (until my next shower). Also, I've noticed that my hair is more shiny and alive, too, after using this for a few weeks. Previously, my hair always looked pale and dry after my shower, but with this, it gleans in the light. I'll be sticking to this shampoo for sure.<br /><br />The only thing I'm slightly disappointed about is the size of this bottle--it's small!   100. For the past year or so since I moved I have been struggling with very greasy skin and hair. I tried getting a water filter for my shower head(which did help some), using volumizing shampoo to lift the hair away from my face( not successfull at all), a moisturizing shampoo -thinking it was because I was stripping all the oil off my scalp and causing it to over produce( made it worse), tried two different clarifying shampoos, tried rinsing with vinegar, I even used Dawn dish soap as a last resort. I spent hours researching different causes and different tricks and I tried them all. I currently have a full grocery bag of shampoo that have only been halfway used. I was starting to really get frustrated when I finally thought... Heck, I'd tried everything else.<br />I was very happy with how quickly it arrived. Only a few days wait time! It even comes with a brochure and little card with information about the main ingredients and what it does. On the back of the card are &#34;showering tips&#34;. Finish with cold water, massage the scalp after shampooing and wait 5-10 minutes before blow drying. I also followed the wash your hair, leave on for several minutes, rinse then repeat. So basically, I wash round one, shave under my arms, rinse, wash round two, shave my legs then rinse the final time. I've been experimenting with which round matters most, and I believe leaving the shampoo in longer during the second round gives the best results.I followed the recommendation to wait before blow drying but I just couldn't bring my self to rinse with cold water...at first. Day one my hair was so fluffy and soft but it didn't do much for the stringy, greasy pieces around my face. Week one went by with gradual improvements, each day a little better than the day before. Still results are so much better than anything else I've tried. I am currently a few days from two full weeks and in the last couple days I finally started doing the final rinse with cool water. This is the ticket!!! As soon as I tried it I saw the best results so far. I am very happy with the Degreaser shampoo and definitely recommend it for anyone who is struggling with greasy, stringy hair

  138. I have thick wavy hair that gets oily after a day, and massively itchy/flaky by day two (basically homebound until I wash my hair). My scalp is still very oily, but as long as the itching is under control, I can get by with dry shampoo and messy updos.<br /><br />However, I think most of the efficacy of this product is shampooing twice, which I never did before. Sometimes I use other shampoos and I notice that my itch is back, so I know Degrease is working after all. My hair does feel squeaky clean, and it lathers well for being sulfate-free. I don't care who you are, your review is worthless. This company offers such free trials to their consumers, which is the only reason why it's rated as high as it is. I too was offered a free trial for my review, considered it, but then ruled against it because I wouldn't have been completely honest with consumers. Nobody who thinks the product is between a 3 and a 4 is going to give it 3 stars and ask for the free bottle.   382. To give a little background on my hair first: ever since puberty hit, I've had very oily hair. I HAVE to wash my hair everyday. Within 24 hours, my hair is all oily and gross. I've tried maybe a few different kinds of shampoo in the hopes of fixing it, but they were all drying type of shampoos that think if you strip your hair of all oils that it goes away, and it just makes it worst.<br /><br />Anyway, on to the review: I bought this shampoo around 2 weeks ago or so. It is summer here, in NC, and I also live near the coast, so the humidity is horrible. I sweat a lot, and when I wipe my face, it tends to get in my hair, which overtime gives the effect of greasy hair. That being said, I obviously haven't tried this shampoo out when I'm not sweating a lot, so that may have some effect on how it's working with my oil issues. It doesn't or hasn't so far, made me be able to go a second day without washing my hair. As I sit here and type this, my hair is all oily and gross, but I washed my hair at 5:30 am yesterday morning, and I did sweat a lot yesterday.<br /><br />I will say, however that it does get your hair squeaky clean. You can hear it squeak in the shower. I have hair down to my elbows and you only need a quarter sized amount to wash your hair. You only need to wash your scalp, not the rest of your hair. Everytime I get in the shower and squirt the quarter sized amount in my hair, I always think &#34;I need more.&#34; I just take a little on my finger tips and start massaging it on various parts of my hair. I scrub the back of my head towards my neck, cause it gets really itchy if I don't wash it everyday. This shampoo lathers so good.<br /><br />I read another review on here about how a lady who had horrible cystic acne would use it as face wash as well. I've been doing that too, seeing as how I have an oily face too. It hasn't changed anything with that yet either, except that if I do have any acne come up, it heals it a lot faster.<br /><br />I mainly got thisshampoo because it is silicone and sulfate free. I saw a girl on youtube talk about how silicone weighs your hair down and essentially creates frizz. I have frizzy curly hair, and wanted to see if it helped. I haven't been able to wear my hair down yet straight from the shower to see if it helps, but I can see a difference when I take my hair down in the mornings before I wash it.<br /><br />I follow this shampoo with the Silk 18, and I will say this: the conditioner smells amazing. I tell my friends that it smells like the good vanilla, not the nasty car air freshener vanilla.<br /><br />I'm thinking that maybe I just need to wait until fall/autumn is here, when I don't sweat as much, and I've really had the chance to see if it works like it's supposed to, maybe my sebaceous gland needs more repair than normal? I don't know. I will update in a few months or so and give you the low down on it then too.

  385. I have long suffered from oily hair. My hair type is straight and fine...and now thinning. If shampooed in the morning, I am usually good for most of the day, however, if in windy conditions or driving in a convertible, the oil production seems to accelerate and my hair is oily by evening. It's certainly oily by the next morning. A few weeks ago I started shampooing Monday, Wednesday and Friday in hopes of lessening the oil production on my scalp that I have read is accelerated by too frequent washing. I was sharing this dilemma with a friend and she gave me a little bit of this shampoo to try. I had enough for two applications, and after the second one(still skipping days) I noticed my hair was definitely less oily on the day after I had shampooed it than it was previously. I am looking forward to getting my own bottle and will report back after extended usage.<br /><br />Update: 6.11.2014<br />Scored my own bottle and have been using it for over a month. For the first week, I found that I had to use it daily. I shampooed twice per shower with a quarter size amount each time. The bottle said to shake, but it is so thick, it doesn't seem to actually mix very well. The bottle is almost opaque so it is hard to tell. I give it a few shakes then wash and rinse once. The second wash I leave on while I continue with my shower. I rinse it off at the end, which will allow it to have set for 3-5 minutes. During the first week my scalp was tingling and while less oily, it looked the same dry as it had before I started using the product and the next morning I felt as if I had to wash again.<br /><br />However, after the first week or so, I woke up one day and my hair looked great! I kid you not. Fuller in appearance and not oily or weighed down. Not as great as the same day wash , but easily good enough for me to not have to wash it again, which really is a first for as long as I can remember. I wash Mon-Wed-Fri now 2x during each shower. The second wash creates noticeably more suds. If the first wash ever gets to that point, I will try to get by with one wash per shower as the product is pricey and rare (you can't just buy it in the neighborhood grocery store). But for me and my particular hair type/scalp it is the best I have ever used.

  412. I am obsessed with the scent of this shampoo. With any hair product, the first thing you notice is definitely the way it smells, and the smell of the Degrease Moisture Control is absolutely gorgeous. This shampoo contains lemon, rosemary, and basil, and that is definitely the smell that comes across. It's a very herbal, soothing scent that reminds of the products used in nice spas. It's odd - I find the scent relaxing at night thanks to the rosemary, and invigorating in the mornings thanks to the lemon. It's such a unique, beautiful smell.<br /><br />But the scent alone isn't why I adore this shampoo. While a lot of degrease shampoos leave hair incredibly dry, even when you follow up with a conditioner, this product leaves hair soft and vibrant. One of my biggest priorities when styling my hair is achieving volume at my roots, and this shampoo does an amazing job of that, even though it isn't sold as a volumizer. However, by truly removing excess product build-up and oil at the scalp, it allows my hair to no longer be weighed down at the root, and to have a lot more volume.<br /><br />This shampoo works a little differently than normal shampoos, and you have to make sure you read the directions, which tell you to let it sit on your scalp for about three minutes. It tingles a little bit, but by no means stings or irritates. My favorite trick when using this shampoo is to copy what stylists in salons do when they prepare your hair to be washed. Before you get in the shower, brush your hair thoroughly, and give yourself a light scalp massage with the pads of your fingers. This breaks up the oil and dirt at the roots and allows you to really thoroughly cleanse your scalp when you shampoo. Between using that trick and this shampoo, my scalp has never felt cleaner, and the health and vibrancy of my hair at the roots is absolutely stunning.<br /><br />This shampoo is a perfect solution for anyone with an oily scalp. It's incredibly effective, but also very gentle. My sister has a very dry hair type and no issues with oil at the roots, but she actually likes to borrow this as a once-a-week clarifying shampoo. I think it is perfect for that, and can be used to deeply cleanse the scalp, even for those who only need such a thorough cleansing once a week or month.

I have an extremely greasily scalp coupled with oily dandruff. i can only keep my scalp in control if i shampoo exactly every 24 hours. in addition, i shampoo twice every time i shower. the only two other shampoos that i find effective to clean my scalp are DHC's clarifying shampoo and nioxin's shampoo for thinning hair (this nioxin actually works better than their formula made for dandruff. i discovered this when i ran out of shampoo one day and had to use my husband's). i found the DHC one too stripping, and this would cause my scalp to get even more itchy. the nioxin was causing too much hair growth - i have a lot of hair already, i'm obviously not their target group. i also was looking for something more natural. on a random search on amazon for oily scalp shampoo, i came across maple holistic's degreasing shampoo. it is a bit expensive considering i go through a lot of shampoo, but i thought i would give it a whirl. i'm glad i did. for the first few weeks, i really felt my oily scalp was totally under control. granted, i still have to shampoo twice (just as their directions say), but i feel like the shampoo is gentle. i also love the ingredient list, no sulfates/sulfites/etc. i'm not sure what ingredients are magically in the shampoo, but i am glad it's around. i also ordered the formula specifically for dandruff, but i find the degreasing one to work better for me. i'm not sure why but the last fews i feel the shampoo isn't as effective. i have been following up with a 50/50 blend of vinegar and water as a scalp rinse to help control my greasy scalp and dandruff. i'll update my review as i continue to use the shampoo. i wish amazon or maple holistics itself offered much bigger sized bottles as i go through a lot of shampoo quickly.

If I get something moisturizing, then I am a greasy mess. I began noticing after I had children that my scalp became VERY itchy. I could not find a shampoo that met all of my weirdo needs! This shampoo does to trick. I can even go a day without washing my hair, which I could NEVER do before. I use the Maple Holistics Silk18 conditioner on the tips of my hair, then use this on my roots. Perfect balance. My husband loves it too! I took off a star because with two adults using this shampoo we go through it very quickly, and at $2 an ounce, it hurts the wallet. Buying the larger size isn't really a discount, but it keeps us from having to replace it monthly. It's well worth it, I am finishing my second bottle. Usually I get a third of the way through a bottle of shampoo and it's in the trash, so I figure it saves in the long run.

  468. I am really loving my first Maple Holistic product, the Shampoo For Oily, Itchy and Greasy Hair. I tend to have oily hair (especially around my hairline) even when I wash my hair every day or two. But a few months ago I resolved to washing less, most especially to avoid using as much heat to style so often. So now I go several days between washes, usually washing on the third or fourth day... and my hair can get pretty oily! I like that the natural oils are nourishing my hair but I like for my hair to feel clean after I wash it and other shampoos were not doing the trick. I would have to wash really well two times to achieve my desired level of cleanliness.<br /><br />With the Maple Holistics shampoo I only have to wash once, saving me time and money AND it is less impactful on the environment. I rinse my hair with very warm water to loosen the oils up and then I split my hair just above my ears and put a little more than a quarter size amount of the product on the bottom half of my scalp, concentrating on massaging it into my scalp and the roots of my hair and letting it set (not pulling it through to the ends) while I do the same at the crown of my head. I usually let it sit for a minute or so while I wash and then I add a bit of water and a little conditioner and massage it into the rest of my hair. After rinsing I condition, concentrating mostly on the ends and trying not to massage into my scalp too much. Then I rinse with cooler water after a minute or so.<br /><br />Now back to the bit where I said I add a little conditioner when I lather the Shampoo for Oily, Itchy and Greasy hair... I found in the first times I used it that, although working nicely to break down the oils, that it was maybe a little too effective, leaving my hair feeling very dry. So I tried letting it set on my scalp for less time but it didn't change the result (and I have found that that step is really beneficial in helping to calm the sebaceous glands, so much so that, at about the half-used mark of my first bottle, I have already noticed that my hair is less oily for the first couple of days after washing). So I decided to see what it would be like to add the conditioner and, wa-la! It felt much better! Before, I didn't feel comfortable running my fingers through after washing, before conditioning, because my hair felt too dry.<br /><br />That being said, the result of having overly-cleaned hair was something I actually expected, given the nature of the product, and it most certainly isn't a deterrent to me continuing to use it. My one suggestion would be to search for a way to make it a little gentler on hair, perhaps coconut or Moroccan oil, if that doesn't tamper with the effectiveness of the product.<br /><br />I will continue to use this shampoo and can't wait to try other products too! I have already told a couple people about it at Thanksgiving dinner!<br /><br />Oh, I almost forgot the mention that it smells great and gives a nice little tingling feeling. Cheers!

I would experience around 1-3 small bumps at a given time that appeared to feel like pimples...but I was never sure what they were. Either way, the itchiness would drive me insane at times. When I gave in and would scratch my head, the number one thing I would notice was how greasy my hair felt. This led me to believe that my oily hair was to blame for the bumps and itchiness I was experiencing.<br /><br />After using this shampoo, I felt relief from the itchiness and the overly greasy hair.   509. I recently tried &#34;Degrease&#34; shampoo from Maple Holistics and was pleasantly surprised. My hair is naturally oily as it is and excess perspiration doesn't help! &#34;Degrease&#34; shampoo truly cleaned my hair/scalp and seems to decrease in excess sweating of the scalp onto hair...stays cleaner...longer!   510. I have been struggling with a greasy scalp & combination skin for as long as I can remember. I recently learned the cheap crap shampoo I've been buying is actually stripping my hair of natural oils and therefore causing my scalp to hyper-produce oil to try to makeup for it.<br /><br />Think you've got oil issues? I can not go a day without washing my hair. If I don't, I look like a sleazy car salesman with all that oil. And my skin feels even worse. My skin is so oily that even if I take a Mexican shower in the sink for my bangs so my hair looks acceptable, my skin is still so oily (even after I wash it) that I can hardly stand it. It feels disgusting.<br /><br />So after some extensive researching, this was one of the few products I could find that didn't have s*** ingredients, but was still somewhat affordable. Since Maple Holistics doesn't have a conditioner I also decided to buy the Wen Cucumber Aloe Cleansing Conditioner since so many people seemed obsessed with it & that one is for oil control. Here is what happened:<br /><br />I got Degrease first & while my stylist said that it could take up to 1 month to fix my issues, the difference after 2 DAYS was insane. For the first time in my life I could go 2 days without washing my hair. My scalp didn't get as oily as usual & neither did my skin. That day was amazing. And my hair just felt SO much better. It was less tangled, more voluminous, all around awesome. And it just feels so clean. Do you know how relieving it is to not worry about all the oil for the first time in my life?<br /><br />It's way better than Wen. I actually dislike the Wen product, my scalp/skin reacts no differently, it gets just as oily, if not worse. And for $30 that was a huge waste. Plus it has Cetyl Alcohol.<br /><br />ONLY Con: It's a small bottle. I wish it came in a much larger bottle with a bulk price tag. I did just notice on their website that if you buy at least 2 bottles, you get them for $12/bottle. Which is certainly much better.<br /><br />(PS if anyone else struggles with oily/combination skin, I just discovered Vasanti BrightenUp! It's unlike any product I've tried for help with my oily skin. It is A+ amazing.)

The only thing that is kind of weird for her is that her hair can literally get squeaky clean with this stuff, so she said it takes some getting used to. She conditions her hair with the Silk 18 conditioner and leaves it in for a good five minutes before rinsing, and although it feels different in the shower than &#34;normal&#34; shampoo and conditioner, she said when her hair dries it's much shinier than it is with other shampoo and conditioners. She said it doesn't feel (literally in her hands) like the conditioner is doing anything, because it isn't slimy like most others, but once her hair is dry, she's really happy with the results.<br /><br />I should add that all people are different, all hair is different, and what works for one person might not work for another. My sister's hair is straight and the hairs are fine, but it's thick because she has a lot of them, and her hair is also naturally oily. Again, she's also fairly sure that she has mild seborrheic dermatitis - so if you're similar to her, she recommends giving this a shot, as long as you condition the middle and ends of your hair properly.

I shower in the morning and by evening, I can feel little oil beads right by the root of my hair.<br /><br />I tried combing, brushing and scalp massaging in the shower - during shampooing, nothing changed. Looks like I have very active oil glands.<br /><br />After trying so many off-the-counter shampoos for oily hair, many with pyrithione zinc etc, nothing worked.<br /><br />After researching, I bumped into this product. I was hesitant to spend $18 for a little 8oz shampoo but I wanted to try it.<br /><br />It works. Period. My hair feels great, fresh and airy. I can feel my scalp breath. Just a little amount in your palm, you get it all over your hair. It creates a thick and creamy foam, almost like those frothy face wash products. Washes off quick, leaves your hair lively.<br /><br />Your hair won't look shiny, it'll look dry and unattended, but that's exactly what I wanted. As a guy with short hair I'm totally OK with that.<br /><br />My only problem is the price. No shampoo - no matter what brand or formulation - should cost $18 for a 8oz bottle. What does 8oz mean? Just to give you an idea, the regular size head&shoulders is 14.2oz and it sells for under $6.00 at Target. The larger ones with pump are 34oz. Walmart has them for $9.37.<br /><br />I understand this is not a mass production Pantene or Dial bottle, but even the clinical strength ones are around $10 for 8oz size.<br /><br />Being a &#34;hollistic&#34; product, not a clinical lab in France, I think it's way overpriced. I'd be happy to pay $18 for a 20oz, but it's just overpriced.<br /><br />Pros:<br />-Works<br /><br />Cons:<br />-Pricey

  651. I have very thick, long, wavy Asian hair, and my scalp can get super oily. In the winter (I'm from the midwest so the winters are terribly dry and cold) my scalp would get so greasy that it would not even dry completely after I washed my hair in the shower. The ends would dry but the part near my scalp at the back of my head, particularly on the underside of my hair, wouldn't get dry--it would greasy, like waxy greasy. Plus the day after I washed my hair my scalp near the front and sides would get super itchy and dandruff-y.<br /><br />After much trial and error I found I was doing a lot of things wrong for my particular hair/scalp situation. Long story short, I started doing apple cider vinegar rinses, which completely rid my greasy scalp, but for a couple reasons, one cannot, nor should, rely on ACV forever. Fast forward a few months and it's the end of summer and I've been messing around with various shampoo/washing routines for a while and have finally figured out what works for my scalp and hair.<br /><br />I wash my hair maybe every 3rd but usually every 4th day, and on that day I start by conditioning my hair, then wash it twice with one of my HG shampoos, then go in with a Shea Moisture shampoo, because I find these shampoos feel very stripping on the hair. I would consider this shampoo from Maple Holistics a HG shampoo if I hadn't found the Aquage Vitalizing Shampoo. THAT shampoo is my holy grail shampoo for getting my hair %100, salon quality, clean feeling. It is everything. My hair does not feel greasy at all for like 2 or 3 days after using it. HOWEVER it is not natural at all and has a disgusting electric blue color. So if you don't want to use a horribly chemically laden shampoo, and if your hair and scalp situation is similar to mine, then this one by MH would be the one I suggest! It's really not bad at all, and hair and scalp get perfectly clean and not dry or irritated, which is what you want. I would shampoo and rinse twice, because this doesn'tlather very much. Also follow up with an extremely moisturizing shampoo if you feel like you need it because this one gives a slightly stripped feeling to the hair, like there's resistance when you run your fingers through it in the shower. I will also note that if you contact the MH people through their website they will send you a good sized free sample (free shipping too) for you to try, which is absolutely lovely. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is simply because I found another shampoo that gets my hair cleaner for longer. But if you want an effective, natural, cleansing, yet non irritating shampoo, this is probably your best bet.

  661. I have fine hair that is extremely oily and I have recently had some mild scalp itchiness. I didn't have dandruff and I don't use mousse or hairspray very often so I knew those weren't the causes. I figured maybe the regular shampoo (L'Oreal Volume Filler Thickening Shampoo) that I use was the culprit because my hair is so oily, I can't really clean my scalp as well as I would like without scouring my skin with my fingernails. So, I found this shampoo online, read the reviews and decided to order it. It is a bit pricey for shampoo but I took the plunge. I have been using it for a few weeks now and I do like it. It has helped tremendously with the itchiness. However, it tends to dry the ends of my hair out more so than regular shampoo, which is why I gave it 4 stars. I do have to use a bit more conditioner on my hair than usual. The shampoo smells lemony and fresh, which I really like. My hair, after drying and styling, is softer and seems healthier. It actually gives me more volume than the volume shampoo that I was using, probably because the volumizing shampoo is filled with insane chemicals that coat my hair and actually weigh it down. This shampoo however is not free of sulfates, which I know is a concern for some. My hair is colored and the color has stood up well to this shampoo. I really recommend this for those with very oily hair. I think if you have normal non-oily hair you will find it to be over-drying. It came nicely packaged with a card explaining how to best wash your hair and the after care once you've shampooed your hair. It also had another card enclosed that detailed the ingredients in the shampoo that help with the oily and itchiness. The bottle is smallish, especially for the price, but it's well worth the expense for the quality of the product.
  662. This product is everything it says it is. I have very greasy hair and I am always looking for something to remedy the situation without drying. I admit I was concerned at first about using something called a \\"degreaser,\\" as I was certain I would end up with horse hair. It just sounds harsh. However, it was not drying at all. In fact, I did not even use condition for the simple fact that I wanted to get the full effect of the product unencumbered by anything else. It turns out conditioner was not even needed.<br /><br />I also have very thin, flat hair, so I was concerned about the tradeoff of switching to this and leaving behind my volume building shampoo and conditioner. This was another needless worry. I simply used this product as instructed and styled as normal using my other regular products and my hair was full, soft, and manageable.<br /><br />In the past when I have tried these types of products they have smelled terrible and they would sting my scalp. I became especially worried about stinging when I realized the instructions said to leave it on for 2 or 3 minutes. However, there was no stinging sensation and the scent was herbal and pleasant.<br /><br />In the end, I have to recommend this product. My scalp does not itch nearly as much, and my hair is definitely not a greasy. This is a product that does what it says.

Although this product tends to cause dryness to the hair due to its degrease efficacy, I only use the conditioner at the lower end of my long hair, without allowing it to touch the top of my scalp, in order to eliminate any chance of exposing my scalp to the oil from the conditioner to avoid clogging up the pores on my scalp, thus reducing the chance of eruption.

On the other hand, it's harsh enough that I CANNOT use this shampoo by itself, I have to use a conditioner. It sounds like a small complaint, I know, but it tells me that to some extent this stuff is still harsh on my hair. Using only my homemade shampoo, I could get away with washing my hair 1-2x a week. If I use just this shampoo, my hair goes back to being a greasy mess within a day or two. (Chemical shampoos stripping oils cause your scalp to produce excess oil, making your hair more oily. It's a vicious cycle.) HOWEVER, if I use this stuff in conjunction with [[ASIN:B00SG3BJ7G Argan Oil Conditioner - By Maple Holistics]], I have no problems. Overall, it's a small price to pay.

I massage a quarter size amount into my scalp and leave it for several minutes, then rinse and repeat. I do not use any conditioner, I just rub a dab of Moroccanoil to the damp ends (My hair is about shoulder length).   742. I've held off writing a review to really give the product a lengthy try. I've had oily hair/scalp my whole life. However, the past 2-3 years it's really amped up, not in a good way. I don't know if it's peri-menopause, hormones, psoriasis, or all the above. I've tried every shampoo out there for dandruff, itchy scalp, etc. None of them really made an appreciable difference. They may have exacerbated the oily, itchy problem. So a few months ago I found myself on amazon once again, searching for something new to try. Anything to help with the itchiness. It has gotten so very untolerable. The itching leads to flakes which leads to embarrassment- if you suffer from flakes and itching, you know this drill well. I was ideally hoping for a complete solution to help what I *think* is psoriasis- and was initially looking at the tea tree shampoo by maple holistics. Almost on a last min whim I decided to go with the degrease shampoo- I hate the name by the way, it's somewhat repulsive to think of degreasing oneself. Anyhow as my overwhelming issue the night I was browsing- has been itchiness, I've been desperate to find something to give some modicum of relief. I can stress enough how horrible the itching has been the past few months- I'd completely curtailed going out in public as much as possible. The itching has lead to scabing in some areas on my scalp and serious pain, both physical and sadly, emotional. It's a horrifying humiliating problem. Maple Holistics shampoo for oily itchy greasy hair really surprised me. I did buy it based on the positive reviews but still I was skeptical. I've been using it for a month now and it has made a huge difference in the itch factor. I have a definite reduction in the amount of itching. It's not gone completely but I'd say conservatively it's about 80% better! I have less build up of scaling. It's not gone, it's not a total solution but my god it's the best thing I've tried thus far. No change for me in the greasiness- I still haveto shampoo daily, but I've always done that my entire life, so it's not a drawback and certainly not a reason to discontinue use. I am thrilled with this shampoo. It has an interesting scent- I'd describe it somewhat like a Pine/Redwood forest after a rainy day. I find it pleasant although I'd prefer something more floral- again, that's just personal preference as a woman. The one thing you should know, especially if you are a woman with med to long hair- this shampoo leaves my hair horribly tangled. I also bought the silk conditioner and I love it! It smells fabulous but I'll leave a separate review for it... just know that you MUST use a conditioner, or you'll be tearing your hair out trying to comb/brush through it. I will definitely continue using this shampoo and will also try the tea tree shampoo to see if it can help with the flaking/scaling and maybe a combination of the two shampoos will help control my problem a bit more. Overall, I am very happy with my results so far, after using the product daily for the last month. A+

  769. This is my first review ever on any website, for any product, period! I am a 31 year old female. I began fertility treatments in Dec 2012 and in May 2013 became pregnant. Since I began the fertility treatments back in Dec, I have gotten red itchy bumps on my scalp, which naturally, I picked at all the time! Not just that, by the hair by my bangs were thinning out, I assume because of the itching. I don't know if I have just developed a sudden allergy to regular shampoos, or if I now have psoriasis, or if it's hormonal, but all I know is I tried so many shampoos that claimed to hydrate, zinc to heal, etc, and none worked for me except the Maple Holistics DEGREASE shampoo. I think the antibacterial agents in this stuff works wonders! I tried the Moisture one too, but it did not work as well for me - it was good on moisture, but the bumps were still alive and kicking! I tried to stop using it after my first bottle ran out, as it is a little pricey, but within a week the bumps were back! So I now use nothing but this stuff and try to keep a spare bottle at all times so I do not run out. It completely gets rid of all issues, including the thinning hair since I don't fuss with my scalp anymore. I don't know how I will be after I have my baby, but so long as I have issues, I will use this product. Website says not to use when pregnant, but my DR. said it was fine.The product is definitely worth a try. If you have success like me, you will be hooked - how could you not be with great results! just glad I'm finally spending my money or something that works.

  771. I have had issues with dandruff and oily hair for a while now. My dandruff used to be really bad but after using their dandruff shampoo and brushing my scalp really well before showering that was mostly aliviated. However my oily scalp issue still stood. I was really surprised at how well this shampoo worked. Before I limited my showers to every 3 days or so but honestly day 2 and 3 were usually suspect. ANWAYS - I immediately noticed a difference when I started using this product. My hair doesn't start to get oily till day 3 or 4 provided I not touch my bangs and use little product.<br /><br />To give you some reference I have wavy hair that I've been coloring for years and sensitive, dry skin.<br /><br />General hair thoughts/advice - brush your scalp THOROUGHLY before showering - it makes such a difference! Get all that dead skin off of your scalp so the shampoo can penetrate. When you use the shampoo make sure to massage it into your scalp (I massage for about a minute), leave it on there for a few minutes, massage again (not sure of necessary the second massage is) and rinse. Also, obviously only use shampoo on your roots and conditioner on your ends - how people still don't know that in this day and age blows my mind.

I found the consistency of Degrease to be a little thick for spreading, which seemed to reduce the lathering as well. I am aware that it is sulfate free, but some lather is good for picking up the oil and washing it away, this was just thick. I have found another shampoo that is less expensive, thinner in consistency (but doesn't drip through your fingers), lathers well and is also sulfate free: Giovanni Certified Organic Golden Wheat for Normal to Oily Hair Shampoo (Eco Chic Technology) and found it at Whole Foods for $8.   853. UPDATE:<br /><br />I returned the shampoo this week. While it did seem to help with the extra oil on my scalp, I was not happy with how drying it was to my hair.<br /><br />******<br />Well this stuff is certainly a degreaser.<br /><br />I have trouble with excess sebum production on my scalp and face, and this shampoo definitely removes quite a bit of the unwanted oil. However, it also leaves my hair a dry feeling the day after using it. It's not terrible, and tends to get back to normal feeling after a day (which is all the time it takes my scalp to make up for the missing oil). I didn't have much problem with scalp itch, except after about 3-4 days without washing my hair (and I figure at that point I deserve it), so I'm not sure I can address that aspect of the product. By the way, I have fine hair which I heat-style 2-3 times a week and shampoo about that often as well. I've been using this shampoo as weekly deep clean.<br /><br />What did disappoint me (and what I had wished I had looked at before ordering) is that despite being called \\"natural\\" from \\"Maple Holistics,\\" the second ingredient of this shampoo is sodium laureth sulfate. All the other shampoos I buy are sulfate-free (which honestly greatly improved my scalp-itch that I used to suffer from before making the switch about 3 years ago). While this isn't a huge deal breaker for me, I probably won't be purchasing this shampoo again.<br /><br />At $17/bottle, I'd hope that it would be less stripping on my hair and be sulfate free. Just a word of warning. Last time I get sucked into buying \\"natural\\" shampoo without inspecting the ingredients. Ah well.

  890. I normally don't write reviews, but I rely on them when purchasing products, so I decided to give this a go. I have been using Maple Holistics Degrease shampoo for a month now. I had been continuously searching for a shampoo that worked for my hair type which is long, fine, oily/greasy, and is falling out quite a bit lately. Other things that were important to me in a shampoo were the ingredients - no sulfates, parabens, etc.<br /><br />A bit about me - I have oily, acne-prone skin, so it is not surprising that my scalp would have similar issues. Recently I was diagnosed with iron-deficient anemia, which is what has contributed to my hair loss. Otherwise, I have no hormonal imbalances or otherwise that would cause oily, shedding hair (just genetics, I happen to be Italian-American).<br /><br />While dealing with my horrible hair, I had tried many different techniques including the &#34;no poo&#34; method, just using baking soda and ACV to rinse my hair. Not a good idea. I also tried Wen, and again, this made me practically go bald! After doing some research about this, I learned a lot about hair and scalp and I just wanted to share that here, in hopes that it may save someone else the frustrations that I went through.<br /><br />Generally I had been washing my hair every-other day, or even every 2 days, as recommended and encouraged by systems like Wen or &#34;no poo&#34;. But now I know that it is important, especially for those of us who have oily or dandruff-prone hair, to wash every single day. The buildup of oils on the scalp can block the follicle and cause the hair to fall out. Once I started washing my hair daily, it stopped shedding in massive amounts. What a relief! I use the Degrease shampoo as directed - a quarter-sized amount worked into the scalp and left to sit for a few minutes, then rinse. It produces a rich lather and rinses clean easily. It does feel a bit drying, so I follow with the Maple Holistics Silk 18 conditioner on the ends of my hair, andit is the most pleasant-smelling hair product I have ever used. After showering and blowdrying, I am left with soft, silky, healthy-feeling hair that smells really good. Oh, and it doesn't feel greasy or oily at all. Living up to its name!<br /><br />Moral of the story is: when in doubt, wash your hair every day, especially if it's oily. Washing 1x per day will not cause it to be more oily or dry. Your scalp is still skin, after all, and you need to care for it in order to have healthy hair, by washing to remove the oil (sebum) and environmental toxins it is exposed to daily. This shampoo is great for people with oily, fine hair, and the ingredients are natural and safe. I will definitely be sticking with this shampoo from now on.

  945. UPDATE (5/5/13):<br /><br />I've added a star because the company now makes this product available for bulk purchase through a different distribution channel.<br />Also, they've since added jojoba and argan oils.<br /><br />*********************************<br />This is probably the only honest review here. None of these reviews were very descriptive - the five star ones were lengthy and questionable, and the one stars give all signs that they were planted by a competing company. Here's what this product comes down to:<br /><br />As a practicing dermatologist for over twelve years, I'd say that in my experience, more patients have come to me with scalp problems than any other. I give them a routine checklist, and can usually tell if the problem is externally or internally induced. There are tell-tale signs that someone is not aware of weather-protection or the practice of massaging the fingers deep to get the dirt out.<br /><br />Bottom line is, \\"oily\\" hair is a very common.and misunderstood affliction. Generally, it's either greasy hair/greasy scalp or dry hair/greasy scalp. Over 90% of the common factors are hormonal, genetical, or the #1 cause-scalp negligence. This is the only cause for dry hair/greasy scalp, and many people have been using five-dollar shampoos and conditioners loaded with ineffective ingredients. A dermatologist appointment is much more expensive than buying a good shampoo-it's pure negligence.<br /><br />Now about the product. I made sure to contact the company and inquire about the ingredients. I'm familiar with natural treatments, and had to make sure this isn't a shampoo that outlines the problems but doesn't offer the necessary treatment. The formula contains cypress, basil, rosemary and lemon. Lemon is cleansing - that's a check - but when it comes to Rosemary, most shampoos use the wrong kind. What makes these oils work is their chemical composition, and depending on location, the constituents vary. They use Rosemary that has the terpene verbenone, which is what improves circulation. I can't tell you how many rosemary shampoos make the mistake of using Rosemary rich in cinenole and little verbenone - which doesn't help the scalp, but is supposed to do wonders for your liver.<br /><br />I know the therapeutic benefits of basil, but I'm not sure why they include cypress. It may be for some synergistic result. (UPDATE 5/5/13: I've been informed that it helps with broken capillaries) Either way, I decided to distribute this to patients to see if it's a shampoo worth giving my recommendation.<br /><br />Out of twenty three patients, nineteen told me the problem was solved (after reusing with following the instructions. It's often overlooked but important). It did nothing for the other four, and three of those four had dry hair and oily scalp.<br />I'm giving this shampoo is a four star rating because it's<br />1) Effective<br />2) Has a pleasant aroma<br />3) Over time, works the gears in the scalp to take care of the problem. But I'm taking off two stars off for these reasons:<br />4) It's not in any stores in my area, so when I recommend it to a patient they have to order it online, an inconvinience for some.<br />5) Revised - it is now available for bulk purchase.<br /><br />All in all, I recommend this to most clients who have greasy hair/greasy scalp. Sebum secretion is something many shampoos fail to heal, but this one succeeds. A message to the company, though: Give an option for bulk purchases! Buying individually is something most companies offer an alternative to. It only makes sense to save money by buying large quantities.verbenone, which is what improves circulation. I can't tell you how many rosemary shampoos make the mistake of using Rosemary rich in cinenole and little verbenone - which doesn't help the scalp, but is supposed to do wonders for your liver.<br /><br />I know the therapeutic benefits of basil, but I'm not sure why they include cypress. It may be for some synergistic result. (UPDATE 5/5/13: I've been informed that it helps with broken capillaries) Either way, I decided to distribute this to patients to see if it's a shampoo worth giving my recommendation.<br /><br />Out of twenty three patients, nineteen told me the problem was solved (after reusing with following the instructions. It's often overlooked but important). It did nothing for the other four, and three of those four had dry hair and oily scalp.<br />I'm giving this shampoo is a four star rating because it's<br />1) Effective<br />2) Has a pleasant aroma<br />3) Over time, works the gears in the scalp to take care of the problem. But I'm taking off two stars off for these reasons:<br />4) It's not in any stores in my area, so when I recommend it to a patient they have to order it online, an inconvinience for some.<br />5) Revised - it is now available for bulk purchase.<br /><br />All in all, I recommend this to most clients who have greasy hair/greasy scalp. Sebum secretion is something many shampoos fail to heal, but this one succeeds. A message to the company, though: Give an option for bulk purchases! Buying individually is something most companies offer an alternative to. It only makes sense to save money by buying large quantities.

  948. I can't really feel any difference between this and a dollar store shampoo besides that this one smells kind of nice. However I have to state that this is a homeopathic product and the ingredient list does not show what percent of each chemical is present for each ingredients. If you don't know what homeopathic means, you might want to wiki it. Basically there is a pseudo science theory that state that by mixing and diluting useful chemical with inert molecules, like water, the useful chemical's material property will somehow be transferred to the inert molecules without the bad side effect. For example, if you take an aspirin pill, dilute it to 1/1 trillion parts with water, and you take a sip of the water, that is suppose to be just as good as aspirin. (aka cut a single aspirin pill into 1 trillion parts, and take that tiny slice with some water). To the credit of amazon, the description did state this is homeopathic. So buyers beware.....

  953. My hair is curly and thicker in texture. It leans more towards \\"normal\\" rather than \\"oily\\" so I was not sure how I would like using this shampoo. The company assured me that the shampoo had been reformulated to accomodate normal hair types as well as oily. OK... that's a little hard to understand because it seems to me that if the shampoo is a \\"degreaser\\" then it might be a little harsh on normal hair. And that's pretty much what my feelings are after having used it for the past 2 weeks.<br /><br />The shampoo has a very earthy fragrance. What was most evident from the very first use of it was that it is a very low-sudsing shampoo. Having such a low-suds shampoo takes some getting used to because you don't get the suds feedback you might be accustomed to. With little to no suds developing as you apply this to your hair and scalp and work it in, you're not sure if you are using enough product. It almost seemed like It wasn't doing anything. But if you then repeat and wash your hair again, the suds level increases to what I consider a more normal level.<br /><br />Given the cost of this shampoo, I tried a slightly different shampoo technique. I actually used a small quantity of my normal shampoo to pre-wash my hair and rinsed, then used the suggested \\"quarter-size\\" amount of this shampoo and washed my hair again. Doing it this way provided a much more enjoyable level of suds.<br /><br />I followed directions and massaged the shampoo into my scalp and hair and let it remain for several minutes before rinsing. My hair literally squeaked as I rinsed the shampoo out which never happens with my normal shampoo. To me that meant that the shampoo had really stripped my hair of all oil.<br /><br />Afterwards, when my hair had dried, it had lost a lot of its normal curl and so seemed flat to me. The fragrance was mild and did not linger for long and was of an earthy scent. I asked my wife to smell my hair and she said it smelled like \\"potatoes.\\" I laughed and wasn't sure if that was a good or bad thing. I've never had my hair described as smelling like potatoes before.<br /><br />I feel this shampoo is definitely more suited to people with hair that is not leaning towards normal, like mine, but more towards oily. It does what it claims to do. But normal hair types may not be totally happy with the degreasing effect and how it leaves your hair.<br /><br />For the proper audience, this is probably a good aid to help with oily hair and scalp conditions.<br /><br />I was provided a complimentary sample of the shampoo so that I could test it out and review it in return for honest feedback.t was a good or bad thing. I've never had my hair described as smelling like potatoes before.<br /><br />I feel this shampoo is definitely more suited to people with hair that is not leaning towards normal, like mine, but more towards oily.   984. Having always had sensitive skin, I had adjusted as well as anyone to the limited availability in the marketplace for personal care products that address sensitive AND oily skin. When appealing to the masses, it seems most companies neglect the needs of this group of individuals. Having become extremely ill early this year, the resulting impact on my liver seemed to be the culprit behind the devastating skin eruptions, painful swelling knots and scabs, etc all over my head/scalp. Use of both prescription and OTC products resulted in zero effectiveness. I had to cut my short hair almost to the scalp so I could just deal with the scalp problems. One OTC \\"clinical\\" shampoo was helpful, but the effectiveness only lasted for part of the day. By evening, I had to rewash my scalp to fend off the \\"blemishes\\". After seeing a list of \\"10 Shampoos for Oily, Itchy Scalps\\", I started trying the shampoos on this list... one at a time. After 3 fails, my next attempt was Maple Holistics Degreaser for itchy, greasy scalps. And miracles of miracles....this shampoo is nothing short of AMAZING! Blemishes,scabs,etc began healing on day one. The infernal itching stopped immediately. Nothing else I tried up to this point stopped the itching AT All. I can now go all day without a breakout and the gross scabs that just pop up all over my scalp. And how happy I am to get to the end of the day and my scalp is still clean and not already greasy in dire need of rewashing. How I use this product: to save money, my first lather is with a clarifying shampoo just to cut through the dust and oil of the day. THEN I squeeze a quarter size amount of product in my hand (and yes, that is ALL it takes). This small amount wonderfully creates an emollient that covers my entire scalp. I massage it in (it feels wonderful) and just leave it. The directions suggest 2-3 min. I don't time it...just leave it while I complete chores, brush my teeth or whatever. It rinses so quickly and effortlessly, it'sactually enjoyable now to wash my hair. For me, Maple Holistics Degreaser is an answer to prayer.

  1008. Why are the ingredients in the description different from the actual ones shown in the photo? There is one notorious one that is missing from the list in the description, and people interested in staying away from toxic chemicals would like to know. The missing ingredient not mentioned? DMDM HYDANTOIN (FORMALDEHYDE RELEASER). About DMDM HYDANTOIN (FORMALDEHYDE RELEASER): DMDM hydantoin is an antimicrobial formaldehyde releaser preservative. People exposed to such formaldehyde-releasing ingredients may develop a formaldehyde allergy or an allergy to the ingredient itself and its decomposition products. There is concern for allergies and cancer on this ingredient. Why the hype for a shampoo that seems to be ALL natural? Can people be deceived this easily?

I did notice that my hair didn't seem quite as oily on the second day after a couple of shampoos, but today was the first day that I didn't have to use anything in my hair on the 2nd day! It didn't look or feel much different than yesterday.<br />I would give this five stars for effectiveness, but it does dry my hair out a bit. If you have fine hair like mine, invest in a quality conditioner (use only on the ends), and find a hair oil (argan or pequi works best for me) you like to put on your ends once they're dry.
